item.title: Vehicle that has been dumped, 20th October
item.description:
This van has been there since Wednesday 15th October, this usually stays for a day or 2 then leaves but hasn’t this time around. It causes a massive safety issue for pedestrians to cross the road to access Carlton Place

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Paul's Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights spontaneously coming on and turning off, 20th October
item.description:
This has already been reported, and it’s been closed, yet the issue still occurs. Opposite 18-20 martlet way, both lights come on when they feel like it and go off when they feel like it whilst the others are still on. This has been going on for weeks now. This is a health and safety issue, especially with the path crumbling where these lights illuminate. It is also putting homes at risk, statistics show, homes that are in dark areas without street lights are more likely to be burgled or targeted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baltimore Court, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continued reported street clean not taking place, 19th October
item.description:
The entire street requires cleaning with a road sweeper both sides of road to clean of sand mud litter buikd up for over 2 years
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Pittville Crescent, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a wide expanse of broken tarmac, 19th October
item.description:
This problem has been reported multiple times. There was even notification of the road to be repaired on the 15th Sept, the road was marked. I received an email to say it was repaired. Sadly, the road was not closed on the 15th, no repair took place the lines around the damage has now worn away. This problem is only getting worse. When will this work be completed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole still not draining, 19th October
item.description:
It's the 3rd time I report issues with drainage for the same spot. With just a few drops of rain, this start accumulated water and we had to use sandbags already. It's not acceptable. Recent ticket was closed and nothing has changed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vineyard Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
